110-xx: Mirror Motor A mirror motor error has occurred.

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JMIRR1 for proper connection to system card, printhead cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If printhead cable or connector is damaged, replace printhead.Go to “Printhead removal”. 2 Replace the system card. Go to “System card removal”. Does the error clear? Problem solved. Replace printhead. Go to “Printhead removal”.
Printhead Error An error has occurred in the cyan channel of the printhead.

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JINT1 (5V interlock switch cable) for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JINT1 cable or connector is damaged, replace 5V interlock switch.Go to “Front access door 5V interlock switch removal”. 2 Check connector JPH1 (large printhead cable) for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 3. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If printhead cable is damaged, replace printhead.Go to “Printhead removal”. 3 Turn printer power on and check for 5VDC between JINT1 pin 1 (red wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Note: Ground lead of voltmeter can be placed on metal chasis to obtain ground. Go to step 4. Disconnect JINT1 and check for 5VDC between pin 1 of system card connector and ground. If voltage is present, replace 5V interlock switch.Go to “Front access door 5V interlock switch removal”. If voltage is not present, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. 4 Reconnect JINT1 if disconnected. Ensure front access door is completely closed. Check for 5VDC between JINT1 pin 3 (white wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Go to step 5. Replace 5V interlock switch.Go to “Front access door 5V interlock switch removal”. 5 Replace printhead. Go to “Printhead removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

Fuser Error An error has occurred in the fuser.

1 Check the input voltage switch on the back of the low volt power supply (LVPS). Is the voltage level (115/230) properly set? Go to step 2. Set switch for proper country voltage. 2 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JFUSER1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go step 3. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If fuser cable is damaged, replace cable. 3 Check connector JLVPS1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go step 4. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If LVPS cable is damaged, replace LVPS. Go to “Low volt power supply (LVPS) removal”. 4 Remove fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Check AC and DC auto-connects on both the fuser and the printer for damage. Are connectors free of damage? Go to step 5. If connector is damaged on fuser, replace fuser. If either of the cable connectors are damaged, replace the appropriate cable. 5 Check for the following continuity between DC auto-connect and FUSER1. Is continuity present? DC auto-connect JFUSER1 pin 9 pin 9 pin 10 pin 10 Go to step 6. Replace DC fuser cable. 6 Check for continuity between the following pins of the AC auto-connect and the pins of the connector that connects to the LVPS. Is continuity present? LVPS connector AC auto-connect pin 1 pin 5 pin 2 pin 4 pin 3 pin 1 Go to step 7. Replace AC fuser cable. 7 Reinstall fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Go to step 8. 8 Replace fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

Autocomp Motor Error Tray 1 motor has failed.

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JTRAY2 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to “Network system card” for fuse location on the network system card. Go to “Parallel system card” for fuse location on the network system card. Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JTRAY2 cable is damaged, replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 2 Measure the resistance across fuser F2 on the system card. Is fuser blown? Go to “Network system card”. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. Go to step 3. 3 Replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
Autocomp Motor Error Tray 1 motor has failed.

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JTRAY2 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. If JTRAY2 cable is damaged, replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 2 Replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
Motor Error Fuser motor has failed.

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JFUSER1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If fuser cable is damaged, replace cable. 2 Turn printer power on and check for 24 V dc between JCVR1 pin 1 (red wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Note: Ground lead of voltmeter can be placed on metal chasis to obtain ground. Go to step 3. Disconnect JCVR1 and check for 24 V dc between pin 1 of system card connector and ground. If voltage is present, replace 24V interlock switch.Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal”. If voltage is not present, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. 3 Reconnect JCVR1 if disconnected. Ensure top access door is completely closed. Check for 24 V dc between JCVR1 pin 2 (white wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Go to step 4. Replace 24V interlock switch. Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal” 4 Replace fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
Motor Error EP Drive assembly cartridge 1 motor has failed

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JCART1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JCART1 cable is damaged, replace JCART1 cable. The cable parts packet contains 1 cartridge motor cable that works for either of the cartridge motors. 2 Measure the resistance across fuser F4 on the system card. Is fuser blown? Go to “Network system card” for fuse location on the network system card. Go to “Parallel system card” for fuse location on the network system card. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. Go to step 3. 3 Replace EP drive assembly. Go to “Electrophotographic Process (EP) drive assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

Motor Error Bump aligner motor has failed

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JBUMP1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JBUMP1 cable is damaged, replace bump aligner motor. Go to “Bump aligner gear removal”. 2 Open the front access door and slowly close it. You should hear the 24V interlock switch closing when the door almost shuts. If you do not, check the switch for damage. Is the switch damaged? Replace 24V interlock switch. Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal”. Go to step 3. 3 Close the front access door. Turn printer power on and check for 24 V dc between JCVR1 pin 1 (red wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Note: Ground lead of voltmeter can be placed on metal chasis to obtain ground. Go to step 4. Disconnect JCVR1 and check for 24 V dc between pin 1 of system card connector and ground. If voltage is present, replace 24V interlock switch.Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal”. If voltage is not present, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. 4 Reconnect JCVR1 if disconnected. Ensure top access door is completely closed. Check for 24 V dc between JCVR1 pin 2 (white wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Go to step 5. Replace 24V interlock switch.Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal”. 5 Replace bump aligner motor. Go to “Bump aligner motor removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

If JDUPLX1 cable is damaged, replace duplex front door assembly. Go to “Duplex front door assembly removal”. 2 Turn printer power on and check for 24 V dc between JCVR1 pin 1 (red wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Note: Ground lead of voltmeter can be placed on metal chasis to obtain ground. Go to step 3. Disconnect JCVR1 and check for 24 V dc between pin 1 of system card connector and ground. If voltage is present, replace 24V interlock switch.Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal”. If voltage is not present, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. 3 Reconnect JCVR1 if disconnected. Ensure top access door is completely closed. Check for 24 V dc between JCVR1 pin 2 (white wire) and ground. Is voltage present? Go to step 4. Replace 24V interlock switch.Go to “Top access door 24V interlock switch removal”. 4 Replace duplex front door assembly. Go to “Duplex front door assembly removal”. Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

Engine Error System card failure

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JTRAY1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JTRAY1 cable is damaged, replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 2 Check transparency sensor for correct mounting. Is transparency sensor properly mounted in paper pick mechanism? Go to step 3. Remove paper pick mechanism, properly install transparency sensor and reinstall paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 3 Replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

POST Error Fuser motor not connected

If connector is damaged on fuser, replace fuser. If the cable connector is damaged, replace the DC auto-connect cable. 3 Check for the following continuity between DC auto-connect and FUSER1. Is continuity present? DC auto-connect JFUSER1 pin 3 pin 3 pin 8 pin 8 pin 9 pin 9 pin 10 pin 10 Go to step 4. Replace DC fuser cable. 4 Reinstall fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Go to step 5. 5 Replace fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
POST Error Printhead motor not connected

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JPH1 (large printhead cable) for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If printhead cable is damaged, replace printhead. Go to “Printhead removal”. 2 Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace printhead. Go to “Printhead removal”.
POST Error Input sensor not connected

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JTRAY1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JTRAY1 cable is damaged, replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 2 Replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
POST Error Narrow media sensor not connected

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JTRAY1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JTRAY1 cable is damaged, replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 2 Check transparency sensor for correct mounting. Is transparency sensor properly mounted in paper pick mechanism? Go to step 3. Remove paper pick mechanism, properly install transparency sensor and reinstall paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. 3 Replace paper pick mechanism. Go to “Paper pick mechanism assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
POST Error Exit sensor not connected

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JFUSER1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If fuser cable is damaged, replace cable. 2 Remove fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Check DC auto-connects on both the fuser and the printer for damage. Are connectors free of damage? Go to step 3. If connector is damaged on fuser, replace fuser. If the cable connectors are damaged, replace the JFUSER1 cable. 3 Check for the following continuity between DC auto-connect and FUSER1. Is continuity present? DC auto-connect JFUSER1 pin 6 pin 6 pin 7 pin 7 pin 8 pin 8 Go to step 4. Replace DC fuser cable. 4 Reinstall fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Go to step 5. 5 Replace fuser. Go to “Fuser removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
POST Error One toner sensor not connected

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JHVPS1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If HVPS1 cable is damaged, replace top access cover assembly. Go to “Top access cover assembly removal”. 2 Remove left cover. Go to “Left cover removal”. Check all toner level sensor cables connected to the rear of the HVPS for proper connection to HVPS, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Are connectors properly connected and cables and connectors damage free? Go to step 3. Properly connect toner level sensor cable if not properly connected. If sensor cable or connector is damaged, replace sensor. Go to “Toner level sensor removal”. If connector is damaged on HVPS, replace HVPS. Go to “High volt power supply (HVPS) removal”. 3 Disconnect JHVPS1 from system card and HVPS. Check for the following continuity. JHVPS1 cable HVPS end System card end pin 14 pin 14 Is continuity present? Go to step 4. Replace top access cover assembly. Go to “Top access cover assembly removal”. 4 Reconnect JHVPS1 cable to system card and HVPS. Do not reinstall left cover, but ensure that front access door and top cover assembly are closed and that the waste toner assembly is reinstalled. Turn printer on. Attach the negative end of the voltmeter to the ground and check the voltage on pin 1 of each toner level sensor cable. You will need to check this on the back of the HVPS (see illustration below). Is there approximately 5 Vdc on any of the pins? Replace toner level sensor that has 5 V dc on pin 1. Go to “Toner level sensor removal”. Go to step 5. 5 Replace HVPS. Go to “High volt power supply (HVPS) removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.
POST Error Cartridge motor 1 (top) not connected

1 Turn the printer off and remove the rear cover. Check connector JCART1 for proper connection to system card, cable for pinch points and cable or connector for any other damage. Is cable properly connected and damage free? Go to step 2. If connector is damaged on system card, replace system card. Go to “System card removal”. If JCART1 cable is damaged, replace JCART1 cable. The cable parts packet contains 1 cartridge motor cable that works for either of the cartridge motors. 2 Remove right cover. Check for the following continuity between JCART1 and top cartridge connector. Is continuity present? JCART1 Top cartridge motor connector pin 1 pin 1 pin 2 pin 2 pin 3 pin 3 Go to step 3. Replace JCART1 cable. The cable parts packet contains 1 cartridge motor cable that works for either of the cartridge motors. 3 Replace EP drive assembly. Go to “Electrophotographic Process (EP) drive assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

The cable parts packet contains one cartridge motor cable that works for either of the cartridge motors. 2 Remove right cover. Check for the following continuity between JCART2 and bottom cartridge connector. Is continuity present? JCART1 Bottom cartridge motor connector pin 1 pin 1 pin 2 pin 2 pin 3 pin 3 Go to step 3. Replace JCART2 cable. The cable parts packet contains one cartridge motor cable that works for either of the cartridge motors 3 Replace EP drive assembly. Go to “Electrophotographic Process (EP) drive assembly removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

If JTRANS1 cable is damaged, replace front door assembly. Go to “Front door assembly removal” for a non-duplex printer. Go to “Duplex front door assembly removal” for a duplex printer. 2 Replace transfer belt assembly. Go to “Transfer belt removal”. Does error clear? Problem solved. Replace system card. Go to “System card removal”.

NVRAM Mismatch Mismatch between operator panel assembly NVRAM and smart chip card NVRAM.

1 Smart chip card If the smart chip card has been recently replaced, go to step 3. If the card has not been replaced go to step 2. 2 Operator panel assembly If the operator panel assembly has been recently replaced, go to step 4. If the operator panel assembly has not been replaced, contact your next level of support. 3 Smart chip card Replace the current smart chip card with the original smart chip card. Go to “Smart chip card removal”. If the error remains, go to step 5. 4 Operator panel assembly Replace the current operator panel assembly with the original operator panel assembly. Go to “Operator panel assembly removal”. If the error persists, go to step 6. 5 Smart chip card Replace the original smart chip card with a new and not previously installed smart chip card. If the error remains, contact your next level of support. 6 Operator panel assembly Replace the original operator panel assembly with a new and not previously installed operator panel assembly. If the error remains, contact your next level of support.
NVRAM Mismatch Mismatch between system card NVRAM and smart chip card NVRAM.

1 Smart chip card If the smart chip card has been recently replaced, go to step 3. If the smart chip card has not been recently replaced, contact the next level of support. 2 System card If the system card has been recently replaced, go to step 4. If the system card has not been replaced, contact the next level of support. 3 Smart chip card Replace the current smart chip card with the original smart chip card. Go to “Smart chip card removal”. If the error remains, go to step 5. 4 System card Replace the current system card with the original system card. Go to “System card removal”. If the error remains, go to step 6. 5 Smart chip card Replace the original smart chip card with a new and not previously installed smart chip card. If the problem remains, contact the next level of support. 6 System card Replace the original system card with a new and not previously installed system card. If the problem remains, contact the next level of support.
NVRAM Failure System card NVRAM failure
POR the printer. Replace system card if message reappears
NV Failure:n CRC error has occurred. This is recoverable.
Perform POR to clear the error.
NVRAM Failure Operator panel assembly NVRAM.
POR the printer. Replace operator panel assembly if message reappears.
NVRAM Failure Smart chip card NVRAM failure.
POR the printer. Replace smart chip card if message reappears.
System card Processor failure on system card (board)
POR the printer. Replace system card if message reappears
Option Error Tray 2 failure
Replace 500-sheet assembly.
